United States players at Fulham[]

To date, there have been a total of sixteen United States players to have been at Fulham, with eleven of these having represented the United States at full international level. Twelve players have played for Fulham's first team, and four others have been at the club without making a first team appearance.

After Fulham signed goalkeeper Marcus Hahnemann in 1999, arrivals from the US became a fairly regular occurance throughout the clubs' tenure in the Premier League from 2001 until 2014. Possibly the most notable of these were Brian McBride and Clint Dempsey, who were equal stand-outs for both club and country at the time.

More recently, defender Tim Ream spent nine years with the club from 2015 until 2024 and made over 300 appearances for the Whites. Antonee Robinson is another, currently plying his trade at Fulham, who although born in England has chosen to represent the United States.

United States staff at Fulham[]

Managers[]

To date, there have been no managers from the United States to have managed Fulham.

Competitive[]

To date, Fulham have never faced United States opposition in any competitive fixture.
